Design of data acquisition module using FPGA so as to control the line voltage/ current signals.  Synthesis and simulations have been performed using MODELSIM and Xilinx ISE tools using Verilog as the HDL.
The module is responsible for calculating the frequency of the generator system so as to maintain the V/f ratio relatively constant over a long period of time.
Also designed a sub-module to sense changes in the frequency and to control the large fluctuations.
A PWM module has also been developed so as to fire the thyristor gating cards so as to control the power delivered to the grids by the generator.
The entire module has been developed in Verilog and has been successfully tested using SPARTAN 6 FPGA from the Xilinx family.

experiences.title: Open Source Program Office Intern
experiences.company: College of Computing at Georgia Tech
experiences.description:
• Collaborated with IBM Research on an AI hardware project using analog in-memory computing, leveraging crossbar array architectures to boost deep learning efficiency and reduce power consumption.
• Integrated MobileBERT into a hardware-aware neural architecture search (NAS) framework, refining model structures for optimal performance in question-answering tasks on analog platforms.
• Trained MobileBERT on the SQuAD dataset using IBM’s AI Hardware Accelerator Kit (AIHWkit) with custom Resistive Processing Unit (RPU) configurations, achieving enhanced inference throughput and energy efficiency.
• Applied Bayesian optimization with Weights & Biases (W&B) to fine-tune hyperparameters, resulting in more stable training and faster convergence across analog simulations.
• Evaluated hardware resilience by monitoring accuracy drift with metrics such as 1-Day Accuracy and Accuracy Variation over One Month (AVM), quantifying noise robustness in analog circuits.
• Developed surrogate models to streamline the NAS process, reducing computational overhead and expediting the discovery of efficient deep learning architectures.

name: Raghav Ramasamy
headline: CS Undergraduate at Georgia Tech | Casca (YC S23) | Prev @ Amazon
about:
I'm Raghav, a senior doing Computer Science at Georgia Tech with a specialization in Intelligence (AI) and Modeling-Simulation. I'm passionate about innovating on an interdisciplinary level and applying artificial intelligence, cloud solutions across industries to create tangible, real world impact. My interests span across Software Engineering, Product Management, and Artificial Intelligence. I look forward to being able to apply my skills to help transform businesses and create social good.

My experiences at Georgia Tech and during my internship at Amazon (AWS), where I helped optimize a core service for global scalability, have helped me develop a strong technical foundation and object-oriented programming skills. I've learnt the lasting impact and importance of designing scalable solutions in enterprise software. Likewise, my internships at Glance and Qdeck.ai have helped expose me to the transformative impact of Machine Learning and Generative AI.

Similarly, my experience building my own startup, Spoony.ai, has given me hands-on experience in building solutions that address real customer needs, learning that true innovation lies in aligning technology with practical problem-solving. It's now clear to me that the key ingredients to building a successful product is spread beyond just high quality software.

I'm a quick learner, critical thinker, and am motivated to drive impact.

experiences.title: Software Developer Intern
experiences.description: This task involves directing eleven team members and contributing to the sensor processing and networking team at the Electronic ARTrium VIP (Vertically Integrated Project). Electronic ARTrium is a multi-disciplinary project that uses various technologies, such as video graphics, electromechanics, and motion-sensing cameras, to create an interactive video game. These technologies are connected through a local Ethernet network, which I optimized using TCP/IP Ethernet protocol by using Python socket programming to connect multiple computers to one another. Electronic ARTrium also includes a barcode-ticketing system to keep track of player information, meant to replicate barcodes used in real-life events such as concerts and amusement parks. I streamlined the ticketing system using Python to generate unique barcodes, which is then scanned by barcode scanners. Through ethernet, barcode data is saved to a MySQL database, which SQL queries can access. Lastly, I directed other team members by establishing timelines for tasks, reviewing code for pull requests, provided resources and tutorials, and directed the creation of design notebooks.

experiences.title: Marketing Team Lead
experiences.description: This task involves brainstorming ideas and conducting community outreach for HexLabs, a student-run 501(c)(3) aimed at organizing educational, innovative, and entrepreneurial STEM events for college and high-school students, with the largest event being the South East's largest Hackathon (HackGT). I assisted in sending 1000+ mass emails to different groups of people, such as event partners, alumni, student organizations, alumni, digital designers, and other university students around the nation to market HexLab's events. I also assisted in brainstorming new content for social media, which led to 25% more engagement.

experiences.title: Marketing Specialist
experiences.description: This job involves a combination of marketing and payroll. For marketing, I am responsible for directing posts that led to an 85% increase in viewership and a 70% increase in social media followers, with Instagram being the primary platform. This was achieved by negotiating with food bloggers and influencers to generate content. I contacted them and offered different rates, depending on how many people followed their accounts. Examples of rates are 20% off of meals or $15 worth of free items for small influencers, while larger influencers would get more compensation. Afterward, I then kept in touch and negotiated to make sure that bloggers and influencers would create media that would represent the restaurant, allowing for greater outreach to people on social media. As for payroll, I accurately calculated employe's salaries by performing calculations that involved job roles, hours worked, and tips. Additionally, I trained new employees for both marketing and payroll tasks.

It received grants to build its factories in Dimona, Migdal Haemek & Beer Sheva in a smaller magnitude as Intel. x employees should be employed by the factories & well busing 5000 employees to Dimona was logistically possible if people didn't mind been picked up at 6am to start work at 6.45am , Didn't happen so amicable trade off .Was not privy to all the details negotiated by the Treasurer & CFO but "very fair play in play" Dimona is a award winning massive glass structure designed for 5000 workers who also receive a substantial sit down lunch.Vishay is one of the best managed Manufacturing.Companies,in Israel and  on top of the logistic nightmare.All production is shipped to a distribution center overseas.Vishay is a Fortune 500 Company. Additionally, I hold multiple certifications, including SSCP, CIAM, and AWS Cloud Practitioner, which demonstrate my knowledge and skills in various domains of Cybersecurity.
